snippet: The use of transfer rules to eliminate many of an athlete’s preferred options illustrates the big-business mind-set of college sports and the control that coaches have over players.
abstract: College coaches are using transfer rule to prevent athletes who wish to change schools from getting many, if not all, of their preferred options; universities have long sought to block student-athletes from transferring to a rival program, but the impulse to limit the student-athlete’s options has been heightened to the point that coaches are now blacklisting dozens of universities.
lead_paragraph: The use of transfer rules to eliminate many of an athlete’s preferred options illustrates the big-business mind-set of college sports and the control that coaches have over players.

headline.seo: College Coaches Use Transfer Rules to Limit Athletes’ Options
headline.main: Want to Play at a Different College? O.K., but Not There or There
headline.print_headline: Want to Play at a Different College? O.K., but Not There or There
